Package sailpoint.object

Class Workflow.Arg

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      • sailpoint.object.Workflow.Arg
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject
    Enclosing class:
    Workflow
    public static class Workflow.Arg
extends AbstractXmlObject
    The representation of a argument whose value can be calculated at runtime. Do not confuse this with the Argument class which is used for the *definition* of arguments in a Signature which is not part of the workflow definition. There are three ways to specify the value of an argument: - a literal Object - a scriptlet to calculate the value - a Script to calculate the value Literal values are unique to Arg, you cannot specify literal values in the GWE, they are intended for use only with scripts or WorkflowHandler code that constructs Approval objects at runtime. When constructing runtime Approvals, you sometimes need to pass in information that is already represented as a Java object, such as a List or an ApprovalSet. Converting this into a Beanshell script that constructs a clone of that object is awkward instead the Arg can just be given the desired value which will then be passed along when the WorkItem is created.
    See Also:
